title: Internet does bizarre maths to find Luigio Mangione's height: 'Few inches taller...'
content: Social media users, after obsessing over Luigi Mangione's appearance, have now estimated his height to be at least 5'10" by comparing him to a police car in photos. The 26-year-old Ivy League graduate is suspected of killing UnitedHealth CEO Brian Thompson and was arrested in Pennsylvania after a five-day search.
summary: Social media users, after obsessing over Luigi Mangione's appearance, have now estimated his height to be at least 5'10" by comparing him to a police car in photos. The 26-year-old Ivy League graduate is suspected of killing UnitedHealth CEO Brian Thompson and was arrested in Pennsylvania after a five-day search.

title: Garland Gandhi wore on Dandi March fails to attract buyers at London auction
content: A garland worn by Mahatma Gandhi during the 1930 Salt March failed to sell at a London auction. The garland, from the collection of Gandhi's personal physician, was estimated at £20,000-£30,000. While the garland didn't find a buyer, other Indian art pieces in the auction saw strong sales, indicating a buoyant market.
summary: A garland worn by Mahatma Gandhi during the 1930 Salt March failed to sell at a London auction.  The garland, from the collection of Gandhi's personal physician, was estimated at £20,000-£30,000. While the garland didn't find a buyer, other Indian art pieces in the auction saw strong sales, indicating a buoyant market.

title: Five Indian students from AP involved in car crash in UK, one dead and driver arrested
content: Five Indian students from Andhra Pradesh were involved in a single-vehicle crash in Leicestershire, England. One passenger died at the scene, while the other three passengers and the driver were hospitalized. The driver, a 27-year-old male, was arrested on suspicion of causing death by dangerous driving and later released on bail.
summary: Five Indian students from Andhra Pradesh were involved in a single-vehicle crash in Leicestershire, England. One passenger died at the scene, while the other three passengers and the driver were hospitalized. The driver, a 27-year-old male, was arrested on suspicion of causing death by dangerous driving and later released on bail.

title: Taliban minister killed in Kabul suicide bombing in ministry
content: Taliban's acting refugee minister, Khalil-ur-Rehman Haqqani, and four others were killed in a Kabul suicide bombing on Wednesday. A suicide bomber, disguised as a visitor, detonated the bomb inside the ministry building. No group immediately claimed responsibility, but the Taliban blamed "infidels." Haqqani, a key figure in the Haqqani network, played a significant role in the Taliban's takeover.
summary: Taliban's acting refugee minister, Khalil-ur-Rehman Haqqani, and four others were killed in a Kabul suicide bombing on Wednesday.  A suicide bomber, disguised as a visitor, detonated the bomb inside the ministry building. No group immediately claimed responsibility, but the Taliban blamed "infidels." Haqqani, a key figure in the Haqqani network, played a significant role in the Taliban's takeover.

title: Did Kimberly Guilfoyle and Bettina Anderson pose together? Photo goes viral amid 'quid pro quo' claim
content: Both Kimberly Guilfoyle and Bettina Anderson were present at the Republican National Convention and were snapped together. At that time, Kimberly sat beside Don Jr while Bettina was sitting in a row behind. Kimberly was sitting between Don Jr and her son Ronan Anthony Villency whom she shares with her second husband Eric Villency. Before Villency, Kimberly was married to Gavin Newsom.
summary: Both Kimberly Guilfoyle and Bettina Anderson were present at the Republican National Convention and were snapped together. At that time, Kimberly sat beside Don Jr while Bettina was sitting in a row behind. Kimberly was sitting between Don Jr and her son Ronan Anthony Villency whom she shares with her second husband Eric Villency. Before Villency, Kimberly was married to Gavin Newsom.

title: Who are Miami's multimillionaire Alexander brothers arrested for serial sexual harassment?
content: ​Three brothers -- Tal, Oren and Alon Alexander -- have been arrested in Miami after a slew of civil suits filed by several women accused them of serial sexual assault. Oren and Alon Alexander are twins and Tal is their elder brother and all of them were taken in custody on state charges.
summary: ​Three brothers -- Tal, Oren and Alon Alexander -- have been arrested in Miami after a slew of civil suits filed by several women accused them of serial sexual assault. Oren and Alon Alexander are twins and Tal is their elder brother and all of them were taken in custody on state charges.

title: Vivek Ramaswamy reacts to Luigi Mangione's anger towards US healthcare: 'Details actually matter'
content: Vivek Ramaswamy addressed a social media post related to the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson and suspected killer Luigi Mangione's anger towards expensive healthcare. Ramaswamy said US healthcare is expensive while Europe benefits from lower marginal costs after US approval. "That’s how Europe arbitrages the U.S. by accessing the same medicines at lower cost. The details actually matter," Ramaswamy wrote.
summary: Vivek Ramaswamy addressed a social media post related to the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson and suspected killer Luigi Mangione's anger towards expensive healthcare. Ramaswamy said US healthcare is expensive while Europe benefits from lower marginal costs after US approval. "That’s how Europe arbitrages the U.S. by accessing the same medicines at lower cost. The details actually matter," Ramaswamy wrote.

title: How Hamas' Oct 7 attack smashed Iran’s ‘Axis of Resistance’
content: The October 7, 2023, Hamas-led attack on Israel marked a turning point for Iran and its network of proxies, leading to their strategic decline. While the attack demonstrated Hamas’s military capability, it overextended Iran’s resources and triggered widespread retaliatory campaigns by Israel. Key proxies, including Hezbollah and Hamas, faced severe setbacks due to depleted resources and loss of territorial control. The Assad regime in Syria collapsed under diminished support. Regionally, Gulf states and Egypt aligned with Israel, and the US intensified sanctions against Iran. This chain reaction weakened Iran’s influence, reshaping Middle Eastern geopolitics and highlighting the consequences of overreach.
summary: The October 7, 2023, Hamas-led attack on Israel marked a turning point for Iran and its network of proxies, leading to their strategic decline. While the attack demonstrated Hamas’s military capability, it overextended Iran’s resources and triggered widespread retaliatory campaigns by Israel. Key proxies, including Hezbollah and Hamas, faced severe setbacks due to depleted resources and loss of territorial control. The Assad regime in Syria collapsed under diminished support. Regionally, Gulf states and Egypt aligned with Israel, and the US intensified sanctions against Iran. This chain reaction weakened Iran’s influence, reshaping Middle Eastern geopolitics and highlighting the consequences of overreach.

title: Luigi Mangione's notebook reveals he considered bombing Brian Thompson but...
content: ​In his notebook, Mangione deliberated: "What do you do? You wack the CEO at the annual parasitic bean-counter convention. It's targeted, precise, and doesn't risk innocents," It's not yet known how he got the gun and how he got the specific timing of Brian Thompson's arrival at the hotel where he executed what he considered a mission.
summary: ​In his notebook, Mangione deliberated: "What do you do? You wack the CEO at the annual parasitic bean-counter convention. It's targeted, precise, and doesn't risk innocents," It's not yet known how he got the gun and how he got the specific timing of Brian Thompson's arrival at the hotel where he executed what he considered a mission.

title: Rally in Bangladesh's capital Dhaka calls for boycott of restaurants not serving beef
content: In Bangladesh, the Muslim Consumers' Rights Council rallied, demanding a boycott of restaurants not serving beef. They accused these establishments of aligning with anti-Muslim ideologies and called beef a symbol of Islamic identity. This protest occurs amidst escalating violence against minorities following the recent political upheaval.
summary: In Bangladesh, the Muslim Consumers' Rights Council rallied, demanding a boycott of restaurants not serving beef.  They accused these establishments of aligning with anti-Muslim ideologies and called beef a symbol of Islamic identity.  This protest occurs amidst escalating violence against minorities following the recent political upheaval.

title: 'CEOs are soft targets': Will Brian Thompson murder spark copycat shootings?
content: UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson's murder has prompted concerns about copycat attacks on executives. Security experts warn of increasing threats against corporate leaders, fueled by social media and public frustration with industries like healthcare. ​"For the general public, this attack on the UHC CEO may seem like an exotic crime, but in the executive protection industry we are dealing with serious threats on a weekly basis," a security firm CEO said.
summary: UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson's murder has prompted concerns about copycat attacks on executives. Security experts warn of increasing threats against corporate leaders, fueled by social media and public frustration with industries like healthcare.  ​"For the general public, this attack on the UHC CEO may seem like an exotic crime, but in the executive protection industry we are dealing with serious threats on a weekly basis," a security firm CEO said.

title: After Trump’s ‘Governor’ jibe, 'feminist' Trudeau calls Kamala Harris loss ‘attack on women’s progress’
content: Trudeau’s comments came amid escalating tensions with US President-elect Donald Trump, who has frequently targeted the Canadian Prime Minister with jibes and taunts. In his latest social media post, Trump referred to Trudeau as the “Governor of the Great State of Canada,” revisiting his earlier joke that Canada could become the 51st state of the United States. The comment, originally made during a dinner at Mar-a-Lago, resurfaced as Trump doubled down, suggesting that statehood might be Canada’s best option to survive the potential devastation of his proposed 25% tariffs on Canadian goods.
summary: Trudeau’s comments came amid escalating tensions with US President-elect Donald Trump, who has frequently targeted the Canadian Prime Minister with jibes and taunts. In his latest social media post, Trump referred to Trudeau as the “Governor of the Great State of Canada,” revisiting his earlier joke that Canada could become the 51st state of the United States. The comment, originally made during a dinner at Mar-a-Lago, resurfaced as Trump doubled down, suggesting that statehood might be Canada’s best option to survive the potential devastation of his proposed 25% tariffs on Canadian goods.

title: Malibu wildfire is raging out of control as dry winds fan flames
content: A rapidly spreading wildfire near Malibu, California, has scorched nearly 4,000 acres, destroying structures and forcing evacuations. Driven by strong Santa Ana winds and dry conditions, the Franklin Fire has prompted widespread power outages as a safety measure. Over 1,500 firefighters are battling the blaze, with no reported casualties yet.
summary: A rapidly spreading wildfire near Malibu, California, has scorched nearly 4,000 acres, destroying structures and forcing evacuations. Driven by strong Santa Ana winds and dry conditions, the Franklin Fire has prompted widespread power outages as a safety measure. Over 1,500 firefighters are battling the blaze, with no reported casualties yet.

title: Watch: Canadian journalist Rachel Gilmore links Freedom Convoy to 'Russian interference'
content: ​​“It was an intriguing time to be monitoring those Telegram channels because, all of a sudden, the ones that had been focused on the Convoy and COVID—groups with tens of thousands of members already inclined to distrust experts, government, media, and institutions—shifted to discussing Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. Often, they claimed the invasion was justified for reasons the government and mainstream media supposedly wouldn’t tell you,” she explained.
summary: ​​“It was an intriguing time to be monitoring those Telegram channels because, all of a sudden, the ones that had been focused on the Convoy and COVID—groups with tens of thousands of members already inclined to distrust experts, government, media, and institutions—shifted to discussing Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. Often, they claimed the invasion was justified for reasons the government and mainstream media supposedly wouldn’t tell you,” she explained.

title: Kamala Harris-critic Kimberly Guilfoyle referred to Donald Trump as 'father-in-law' until...
content: Guilfoyle left Fox in 2018 and joined America First Policies, a Trump super PAC to campaign for Republicans in the 2018 midterm elections. But at that time she was already dating Donald Trump Jr. And according to reports, she was fired from Fox over a sexual harassment accusation from a female assistant. Reports said Fox had been in the middle of a year-long investigation into the allegation when she left.
summary: Guilfoyle left Fox in 2018 and joined America First Policies, a Trump super PAC to campaign for Republicans in the 2018 midterm elections. But at that time she was already dating Donald Trump Jr. And according to reports, she was fired from Fox over a sexual harassment accusation from a female assistant. Reports said Fox had been in the middle of a year-long investigation into the allegation when she left.

title: 'Direct threat': NYPD warns healthcare executives after UnitedHealthcare CEO's murder
content: A surge of social media activity has targeted prominent figures in the health insurance industry, publishing their names and salaries, and in some cases, featuring them on "Wanted" posters plastered across Manhattan. These posters bear provocative imagery, including bullet-shaped graphics, alongside slogans such as "UnitedHealthcare killed everyday people for the sake of profit. As a result, Brian Thompson was denied his claim to life. Who will be denied next?" and "Wall Street CEOs Should Not Feel Safe. Deny, Defend, Depose."
summary: A surge of social media activity has targeted prominent figures in the health insurance industry, publishing their names and salaries, and in some cases, featuring them on "Wanted" posters plastered across Manhattan. These posters bear provocative imagery, including bullet-shaped graphics, alongside slogans such as "UnitedHealthcare killed everyday people for the sake of profit. As a result, Brian Thompson was denied his claim to life. Who will be denied next?" and "Wall Street CEOs Should Not Feel Safe. Deny, Defend, Depose."

title: Watch: Syrian rebels torch tomb of Assad's father
content: Rebels set ablaze the tomb of Hafez al-Assad, the former Syrian president and father of Bashar al-Assad, in Qardaha, Latakia province. The mausoleum, also containing the remains of other Assad family members, was destroyed following the rebels' swift capture of key cities and Assad's subsequent departure from power, ending the family's five-decade rule.
summary: Rebels set ablaze the tomb of Hafez al-Assad, the former Syrian president and father of Bashar al-Assad, in Qardaha, Latakia province.  The mausoleum, also containing the remains of other Assad family members, was destroyed following the rebels' swift capture of key cities and Assad's subsequent departure from power, ending the family's five-decade rule.

title: Donald Trump Jr's congratulatory post for Kimberly Guilfoyle called 'hell of a breakup letter'
content: As Donald Trump sends Don Jr's fiancee to Greece making her the ambassador amid speculations of Don Jr and Kimberly Guilfoyle's break-up, social media users were curious to know when the two broke up. Turned out they haven't officially but Don Jr's congratulatory post for Guilfoyle could be read as a 'break up' letter, social media users commented as he seemed to be thrilled that Guilfoyle would be in Greece.
summary: As Donald Trump sends Don Jr's fiancee to Greece making her the ambassador amid speculations of Don Jr and Kimberly Guilfoyle's break-up, social media users were curious to know when the two broke up. Turned out they haven't officially but Don Jr's congratulatory post for Guilfoyle could be read as a 'break up' letter, social media users commented as he seemed to be thrilled that Guilfoyle would be in Greece.

title: 'Ban OnlyFans': Adult star Lily Phillips breaks down after sleeping with 101 guys in one day
content: Adult star Lily Phillips, 23, gained attention after sleeping with 101 men in a day for an OnlyFans challenge, documented by YouTuber Josh Pieters. Despite earning £2 million on the platform, Lily admitted the experience was overwhelming and left her visibly shaken. Public reaction has been polarized, with critics calling it degrading and demanding an OnlyFans ban, while others empathize with her or defend the platform. Lily has expressed interest in even larger challenges, sparking debates about personal choice and societal impact. Supporters argue the issue lies with societal attitudes, not the platform, opposing outright bans.
summary: Adult star Lily Phillips, 23, gained attention after sleeping with 101 men in a day for an OnlyFans challenge, documented by YouTuber Josh Pieters. Despite earning £2 million on the platform, Lily admitted the experience was overwhelming and left her visibly shaken. Public reaction has been polarized, with critics calling it degrading and demanding an OnlyFans ban, while others empathize with her or defend the platform. Lily has expressed interest in even larger challenges, sparking debates about personal choice and societal impact. Supporters argue the issue lies with societal attitudes, not the platform, opposing outright bans.

title: 'F**king gross': Has Joe Rogan supported Brian Thompson killer Luigi Mangione?
content: Unlike former Washington Post journalist Taylor Lorenz, podcaster Joe Rogan did not support the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson but on the latest episode of his show, he spoke about the insurance industry and called it a dirty business. Joe Rogan said he thinks the suspected killer, Luigi Mangione, is not a professional but somehow got 'f**ked over' by the health insurance company.
summary: Unlike former Washington Post journalist Taylor Lorenz, podcaster Joe Rogan did not support the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson but on the latest episode of his show, he spoke about the insurance industry and called it a dirty business. Joe Rogan said he thinks the suspected killer, Luigi Mangione, is not a professional but somehow got 'f**ked over' by the health insurance company.
